text: Imogen or Imogene [ im-uh-jeen ] is an English first name. Imogen is an exquisite name that has been increasingly popular in modern times. The name boasts a noteworthy heritage and profound significance. Imogen has its roots in the Celtic culture and signifies "maiden" or "innocent." The name has been in use for centuries and has been linked to many notable figures across history. The first recorded use of the name is under the English playwright William Shakespeare. It is chiefly used as a given name in several countries. They include Canada, the United States, Ireland, Australia and South Africa. == People == * Imogen Poots, British actress * Imogen Heap, British musician * Imogen Hassall, English actress (1942-1980) Imogen or Imogene was used on several celebrities, including Imogene Coca and Imogen Hassall. ==References== Category:Given names
title: Imogen
